articles.headline: For a Black Mathematician, What It’s Like to Be the ‘Only One’
articles.snippet: Fewer than 1 percent of doctorates in math are awarded to African-Americans. Edray Goins, who earned one of them, found the upper reaches of the math world a challenging place.
articles.abstract: Fewer than 1 percent of doctorates in math are awarded to African-Americans. Edray Goins, who earned one of them, found the upper reaches of the math world a challenging place.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — It was not an overt incident of racism that prompted Edray Goins, an African-American mathematician in the prime of his career, to abandon his tenured position on the faculty of a major research university last year.

articles.headline: A Real Tube Carrying Dreams of 600-M.P.H. Transit
articles.snippet: Virgin Hyperloop One is testing a system that would put passengers in pods hurtling through vacuum tubes. Other companies are moving ahead with similar plans.
articles.abstract: Virgin Hyperloop One is testing a system that would put passengers in pods hurtling through vacuum tubes. Other companies are moving ahead with similar plans.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOAPA, Nev. — California just decided to sharply scale back its plans for a high-speed rail artery meant to transform travel up and down the state. But in the desert outside Las Vegas, the transportation ambitions still seem limitless.

articles.headline: Trump Delivers Blunt Warning to Venezuela Military Over Aid Impasse
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump warned Venezuelan soldiers to renounce loyalty to President Nicolás Maduro or they will find “no safe harbor.”
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump warned Venezuelan soldiers to renounce loyalty to President Nicolás Maduro or they will find “no safe harbor.”
articles.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — President Trump on Monday delivered his sharpest warning yet to Venezuela’s military authorities in an increasingly tense showdown over that country’s crisis, proclaiming they would “lose everything” by remaining loyal to President Nicolás Maduro and refusing to allow in emergency aid stockpiled on the border.
articles.byline: By Annie Karni, Nicholas Casey and Anatoly Kurmanaev

articles.headline: Amazon Resets Its Film Operation After Rough Year at Box Office
articles.snippet: The tech giant put “too much focus” on art-house fare, said Jennifer Salke, the head of Amazon Studios. It will now focus more on films for a broader audience, including “sexy date-night movies.”
articles.abstract: The tech giant put “too much focus” on art-house fare, said Jennifer Salke, the head of Amazon Studios. It will now focus more on films for a broader audience, including “sexy date-night movies.”
articles.lead_paragraph: CULVER CITY, Calif. — The film business has chewed up Amazon over the last year and a half.

articles.headline: 16 States Sue to Stop Trump’s Use of Emergency Powers to Build Border Wall
articles.snippet: A coalition of 16 states, including California and New York, is challenging President’s Trump use of emergency powers to spend billions on a border wall.
articles.abstract: A coalition of 16 states, including California and New York, is challenging President’s Trump use of emergency powers to spend billions on a border wall.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A coalition of 16 states, including California and New York, on Monday challenged President Trump in court over his plan to use emergency powers to spend billions of dollars on his border wall.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage and Robert Pear

articles.headline: YouTube Unleashed a Conspiracy Theory Boom. Can It Be Contained?
articles.snippet: What if stemming the tide of misinformation on YouTube means punishing some of its biggest stars?
articles.abstract: What if stemming the tide of misinformation on YouTube means punishing some of its biggest stars?
articles.lead_paragraph: Last month, the YouTube star Shane Dawson uploaded his new project: a 104-minute documentary, “Conspiracy Theories With Shane Dawson.”

articles.headline: As McKinsey Sells Advice, Its Hedge Fund May Have a Stake in the Outcome
articles.snippet: The world’s most prestigious consulting firm has a secretive $12.3 billion investment arm, prompting questions about conflicts of interest.
articles.abstract: The world’s most prestigious consulting firm has a secretive $12.3 billion investment arm, prompting questions about conflicts of interest.
articles.lead_paragraph: The sins of Valeant Pharmaceuticals are well known. Instead of spending to develop new drugs, Valeant bought out other drugmakers, then increased prices of lifesaving medicines by as much as 5,785 percent. Patients had no choice but to pay.
articles.byline: By Michael Forsythe, Walt Bogdanich and Bridget Hickey

articles.headline: Bernie Sanders, Once the Progressive Outlier, Joins a Crowded Presidential Field
articles.snippet: Mr. Sanders, the runner-up in the 2016 Democratic primaries, is embarking on a bid that will test whether he can retain the anti-establishment appeal he enjoyed with liberals three years ago.
articles.abstract: Mr. Sanders, the runner-up in the 2016 Democratic primaries, is embarking on a bid that will test whether he can retain the anti-establishment appeal he enjoyed with liberals three years ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Bernie Sanders, the Vermont independent and 2016 Democratic primary runner-up whose populist agenda has helped push the party to the left, embarked on Tuesday on a second run for president, in a bid that will test whether he retains his anti-establishment appeal or loses ground to newer faces who have adopted many of his ideas.
